19class BigInt;
20class SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded;
21
22// uint64_t constants prefixed with kFP64 are bit patterns of doubles.
23// uint64_t constants prefixed with kFP16 are bit patterns of doubles encoding
24// limits of half-precision floating point values.
25constexpr int kFP64ExponentBits = 11;
26constexpr int kFP64MantissaBits = 52;
27constexpr uint64_t kFP64ExponentBias = 1023;
28constexpr uint64_t kFP64SignMask = uint64_t{1}
29 << (kFP64ExponentBits + kFP64MantissaBits);
30constexpr uint64_t kFP64Infinity = uint64_t{2047} << kFP64MantissaBits;
31constexpr uint64_t kFP16InfinityAndNaNInfimum = (kFP64ExponentBias + 16)
32 << kFP64MantissaBits;
33constexpr uint64_t kFP16MinExponent = kFP64ExponentBias - 14;
34constexpr uint64_t kFP16DenormalThreshold = kFP16MinExponent
35 << kFP64MantissaBits;
36
37constexpr int kFP16MantissaBits = 10;
38constexpr uint16_t kFP16qNaN = 0x7e00;
39constexpr uint16_t kFP16Infinity = 0x7c00;
40
41// A value that, when added, has the effect that if any of the lower 41 bits of
42// the mantissa are set, the 11th mantissa bit from the front becomes set. Used
43// for rounding when converting from double to half-precision.
44constexpr uint64_t kFP64To16RoundingAddend =
45 (uint64_t{1} << ((kFP64MantissaBits - kFP16MantissaBits) - 1)) - 1;
46// A value that, when added, rebiases the exponent of a double to the range of
47// the half precision and performs rounding as described above in
48// kFP64To16RoundingAddend. Note that 15-kFP64ExponentBias overflows into the
49// sign bit, but that bit is implicitly cut off when assigning the 64-bit double
50// to a 16-bit output.
51constexpr uint64_t kFP64To16RebiasExponentAndRound =
52 ((uint64_t{15} - kFP64ExponentBias) << kFP64MantissaBits) +
53 kFP64To16RoundingAddend;
54// A magic value that aligns 10 mantissa bits at the bottom of the double when
55// added to a double using floating point addition. Depends on floating point
56// addition being round-to-nearest-even.
57constexpr uint64_t kFP64To16DenormalMagic =
58 (kFP16MinExponent + (kFP64MantissaBits - kFP16MantissaBits))
59 << kFP64MantissaBits;
60
61// The limit for the the fractionDigits/precision for toFixed, toPrecision
62// and toExponential.
63const int kMaxFractionDigits = 100;
64
65// The fast double-to-(unsigned-)int conversion routine does not guarantee
66// rounding towards zero.
67// If x is NaN, the result is INT_MIN. Otherwise the result is the argument x,
68// clamped to [INT_MIN, INT_MAX] and then rounded to an integer.
69inline int FastD2IChecked(double x) {
70 if (!(x >= INT_MIN)) return INT_MIN; // Negation to catch NaNs.
71 if (x > INT_MAX) return INT_MAX;
72 return static_cast<int>(x);
73}
74
75// The fast double-to-(unsigned-)int conversion routine does not guarantee
76// rounding towards zero.
77// The result is undefined if x is infinite or NaN, or if the rounded
78// integer value is outside the range of type int.
79inline int FastD2I(double x) {
80 DCHECK(x <= INT_MAX);
81 DCHECK(x >= INT_MIN);
82 return static_cast<int32_t>(x);
83}
84
85inline unsigned int FastD2UI(double x);
86
87inline double FastI2D(int x) {
88 // There is no rounding involved in converting an integer to a
89 // double, so this code should compile to a few instructions without
90 // any FPU pipeline stalls.
91 return static_cast<double>(x);
92}
93
94inline double FastUI2D(unsigned x) {
95 // There is no rounding involved in converting an unsigned integer to a
96 // double, so this code should compile to a few instructions without
97 // any FPU pipeline stalls.
98 return static_cast<double>(x);
99}
100
101// This function should match the exact semantics of ECMA-262 20.2.2.17.
102inline float DoubleToFloat32(double x);
103V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE float DoubleToFloat32_NoInline(double x);
104
105// This function should match the exact semantics of truncating x to
106// IEEE 754-2019 binary16 format using roundTiesToEven mode.
107inline uint16_t DoubleToFloat16(double x);
108
109// This function should match the exact semantics of ECMA-262 9.4.
110inline double DoubleToInteger(double x);
111
112// This function should match the exact semantics of ECMA-262 9.5.
113inline int32_t DoubleToInt32(double x);
114V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE int32_t DoubleToInt32_NoInline(double x);
115
116// This function should match the exact semantics of ECMA-262 9.6.
117inline uint32_t DoubleToUint32(double x);
118
119// These functions have similar semantics as the ones above, but are
120// added for 64-bit integer types.
121inline int64_t DoubleToInt64(double x);
122inline uint64_t DoubleToUint64(double x);
123
124// Enumeration for allowing octals and ignoring junk when converting
125// strings to numbers.
126enum ConversionFlags {
127 NO_CONVERSION_FLAGS = 0,
128 ALLOW_HEX = 1,
129 ALLOW_OCTAL = 2,
130 ALLOW_IMPLICIT_OCTAL = 4,
131 ALLOW_BINARY = 8,
132 ALLOW_TRAILING_JUNK = 16
133};
134
135// Converts a string into a double value according to ECMA-262 9.3.1
136double StringToDouble(base::Vector<const uint8_t> str, int flags,
137 double empty_string_val = 0);
138double StringToDouble(base::Vector<const base::uc16> str, int flags,
139 double empty_string_val = 0);
140// This version expects a zero-terminated character array.
141double V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE StringToDouble(const char* str, int flags,
142 double empty_string_val = 0);
143
144double StringToInt(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> string, int radix);
145
146// This follows https://tc39.github.io/proposal-bigint/#sec-string-to-bigint
147// semantics: "" => 0n.
148MaybeHandle<BigInt> StringToBigInt(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> string);
149
150// This version expects a zero-terminated character array. Radix will
151// be inferred from string prefix (case-insensitive):
152// 0x -> hex
153// 0o -> octal
154// 0b -> binary
155template <typename IsolateT>
156EXPORT_TEMPLATE_DECLARE(V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE)
157MaybeHandle<BigInt> BigIntLiteral(IsolateT* isolate, const char* string);
158
159const int kDoubleToCStringMinBufferSize = 100;
160
161// Converts a double to a string value according to ECMA-262 9.8.1.
162// The buffer should be large enough for any floating point number.
163// 100 characters is enough.
164V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE const char* DoubleToCString(double value,
165 base::Vector<char> buffer);
166
167V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE std::unique_ptr<char[]> BigIntLiteralToDecimal(
168 LocalIsolate* isolate, base::Vector<const uint8_t> literal);
169// Convert an int to a null-terminated string. The returned string is
170// located inside the buffer, but not necessarily at the start.
171V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE const char* IntToCString(int n, base::Vector<char> buffer);
172
173// Additional number to string conversions for the number type.
174// The caller is responsible for calling free on the returned pointer.
175char* DoubleToFixedCString(double value, int f);
176char* DoubleToExponentialCString(double value, int f);
177char* DoubleToPrecisionCString(double value, int f);
178char* DoubleToRadixCString(double value, int radix);
179
180static inline bool IsMinusZero(double value) {
181 return base::bit_cast<int64_t>(value) == base::bit_cast<int64_t>(-0.0);
182}
183
184// Returns true if value can be converted to a SMI, and returns the resulting
185// integer value of the SMI in |smi_int_value|.
186inline bool DoubleToSmiInteger(double value, int* smi_int_value);
187
188inline bool IsSmiDouble(double value);
189
190// Integer32 is an integer that can be represented as a signed 32-bit
191// integer. It has to be in the range [-2^31, 2^31 - 1].
192// We also have to check for negative 0 as it is not an Integer32.
193inline bool IsInt32Double(double value);
194
195// UInteger32 is an integer that can be represented as an unsigned 32-bit
196// integer. It has to be in the range [0, 2^32 - 1].
197// We also have to check for negative 0 as it is not a UInteger32.
198inline bool IsUint32Double(double value);
199
200// Tries to convert |value| to a uint32, setting the result in |uint32_value|.
201// If the output does not compare equal to the input, returns false and the
202// value in |uint32_value| is left unspecified.
203// Used for conversions such as in ECMA-262 15.4.2.2, which check "ToUint32(len)
204// is equal to len".
205inline bool DoubleToUint32IfEqualToSelf(double value, uint32_t* uint32_value);
206
207// Convert from Number object to C integer.
208inline uint32_t PositiveNumberToUint32(Tagged<Object> number);
209inline int32_t NumberToInt32(Tagged<Object> number);
210inline uint32_t NumberToUint32(Tagged<Object> number);
211inline int64_t NumberToInt64(Tagged<Object> number);
212inline uint64_t PositiveNumberToUint64(Tagged<Object> number);
213
214double StringToDouble(Isolate* isolate, Handle<String> string, int flags,
215 double empty_string_val = 0.0);
216double FlatStringToDouble(Tagged<String> string, int flags,
217 double empty_string_val);
218
219// String to double helper without heap allocation.
220// Returns base::nullopt if the string is longer than
221// {max_length_for_conversion}. 23 was chosen because any representable double
222// can be represented using a string of length 23.
223V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE base::Optional<double> TryStringToDouble(
224 LocalIsolate* isolate, Handle<String> object,
225 int max_length_for_conversion = 23);
226
227// Return base::nullopt if the string is longer than 20.
228V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE base::Optional<double> TryStringToInt(LocalIsolate* isolate,
229 Handle<String> object,
230 int radix);
231
232inline bool TryNumberToSize(Tagged<Object> number, size_t* result);
233
234// Converts a number into size_t.
235inline size_t NumberToSize(Tagged<Object> number);
236
237// returns DoubleToString(StringToDouble(string)) == string
238V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool IsSpecialIndex(
239 Tagged<String> string, SharedStringAccessGuardIfNeeded& access_guard);
240V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE bool IsSpecialIndex(Tagged<String> string);
